citeinfo.title: Buffelgrass Pheno Forecast, Arizona, 2019 - Current Year
USA National Phenology Network, Gridded Data Product Suite

descript.abstract: Pheno Forecast maps predict key life cycle stages in invasive and pest species, to improve management efficacy. The buffelgrass Pheno Forecast is based on known precipitation thresholds for triggering green-up to a level where management actions are most effective based on research presented in Wallace et al. 2016*. Daily values represent the 24 day prior precipitation accumulation. 24 day accumulated precipitation values are derived from PRISM daily precipitation data. These maps are updated daily and predict green-up one to two weeks in the future. * Wallace, C.S.A.; Walker, J.J.; Skirvin, S.M.; Patrick-Birdwell, C.; Weltzin, J.F.; Raichle, H. 2016. Mapping Presence and Predicting Phenological Status of Invasive Buffelgrass in Southern Arizona Using MODIS, Climate and Citizen Science Observation Data. Remote Sens. 8: 524.
descript.purpose: These data were created to be used by land managers to helps efforts to control bufflegrass by predicting when species are most susceptible to treatment.

idinfo.useconst: Please cite these products as follows: [Author] [Year Published] [Dataset Title] {as of [DOY] (for continuous daily data) | Year(s) [Year(s)] (for annual products) | Date [Date] (for daily products) } for Region [Coordinates]. [Parameterized URL for Data Download] [Data Owner][City/State] Dataset Accessed [Date of Access] at [DOI Link]. Example: USA National Phenology Network. 2019. Buffelgrass Pheno Forecast, Arizona 2019-03-02. Region: 37.00, -109.04 (UR); 31.33, -114.81 (LL). http://data.usanpn.org/geoserver-request-builder?service=wms&layer=Precipitation:buffelgrass_prism&date=2019-03-02&format=image/png&projection=4269&width=1700&height=800 . USA-NPN, Tucson, Arizona, USA. Data set accessed 2019-3-4 at http://dx.doi.org/10.25422/azu.data.14273081.v1.
idinfo.native: Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.13.0-85-generic x86_64); WMS/WCS Implementation: Geoserver 2.8; Raster Data Housed in PostgreSQL 9.4.5

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: Data is provided as-is. No logical accuracy tests are performed beyond that done by the original data publishers.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: PRISM Climate Group, Oregon State University
citeinfo.title: PRISM Recent Year Climate Data

srcinfo.srccontr: Used to calculate 30 day rolling window of precipitation accumulation.

procstep.procdesc: PRISM precipitation data is retrieved for previous day.
Previous day precipitation values are accumulated with data from the prior 24 days to determine locations within the area of interest where accumulation levels have reached the target threshold.
A new map is produced for the current day showing cells where the precipitation threshold has been met.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
